content:
On 18 - 19 November 2021 there is an event organized by Matías Menni and Luis Turcio:
"A short, informal meeting on Category Theory and an opportunity to celebrate Francisco 'Quico' Marmolejo's 60th birthday."

The event is organized in Ciudad de México but will take place online because of the Covid pandemic. For more information, see the webpage.

Regarding the topic, the website states: "Since we will be celebrating Quico's birthday we particularly encourage talks on Pseudo-monads, distributive laws, Toposes and/or Axiomatic Cohesion." Confirmed participants are Anders Kock, Susan Niefield, Robert Paré and Robert Rosebrugh.
There is now a preliminary list of talks here.

That webpage also has abstracts, but here are the speakers and talk titles:

Jens Hemelaer - Are precohesive geometric morphisms locally connected?
Anders Kock - From Riemannian metric to volume form: Heron's formula.
Susan Niefield - Linear skew-bicategories
Juan Orendain - Globularly generated double categories: Then and now.
Axel Osmond - Bistable pseudofunctors and bifactorization 2-geometries for Grothendieck topoi.
Robert Paré - The double theory of monads.
Morgan Rogers - A map of properties of geometric morphisms.
Bob Rosebrugh - The algebra of lenses.
Carlos Segovia - The classifying space of the 1+1 dimensional free $G$-cobordism category.
Luca Spada - Some remarks about rigs.
Thomas Streicher - Precohesive toposes over arbitrary base toposes.
Adrián Vazquez - The double category of adjunctions through the 2-adjunction of type Adj-Mnd.
Charles Walker - No-iteration pseudodistributive laws.
Richard J. Wood - Towards a characterization of totally distributive categories.
William Zuluaga - Coextensive varieties and the Gaeta topos: An algebraic overview
